com.tambapps.gmage

Class Gmage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tambapps.gmage.Gmage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    UndoRedoGmage

    public class Gmage
extends Object
    Represent an image (0, 0) is the top left corner. That means X-axis goes from left to right Y-axis goes from top to bottom

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gmage

        public Gmage(int width,
             int height,
             Color[] pixels)
        Constructs a gmage with the given dimensions. The supplied pixels array must have length of width * height. It represents the pixels in 1-D of this gmage
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the gmage
        height - the height of the gmage
        pixels - the pixels of the gmage

      • Gmage

        public Gmage(int width,
             int height)
        Constructs a gmage with the given dimensions. All pixels are initialized black
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the gmage
        height - the height of the gmage

      • Gmage

        public Gmage(int width,
             int height,
             Color defaultColor)
        Constructs a gmage with the given dimensions. All pixels are initialized with the provided default color
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the gmage
        height - the height of the gmage
        defaultColor - the color of all pixels

      • putAt

        public void putAt(List<Number> xy,
                  Color value)
        Modify the pixel at coordinates (xy[0], xy[1]). A list was used for xy coordinates to make this method groovy friendly => gmage[x,y] = 0xffffff
        Parameters:
        xy - a list of two elements: x and y coordinates
        value - the color to put at this coordinate

      • putAt

        public void putAt(List<Number> xy,
                  Number value)
        Modify the pixel at coordinates (xy[0], xy[1]). A list was used for xy coordinates to make this method groovy friendly => gmage[x,y] = 0xffffff
        Parameters:
        xy - a list of two elements: x and y coordinates
        value - the ARGB color to put at this coordinate

      • putAt

        public void putAt(List<Number> xy,
                  Integer value)
        Modify the pixel at coordinates (xy[0], xy[1]). A list was used for xy coordinates to make this method groovy friendly => gmage[x,y] = 0xffffff
        Parameters:
        xy - a list of two elements: x and y coordinates
        value - the RGB color to put at this coordinate

      • set

        public void set(Gmage gmage)
        copy this gmage into the one passed in parameter. Both gmage must have the same size to be able to perform this operation
        Parameters:
        gmage - the target gmage to copy into

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        public Gmage scaledBy(Number factor)
        Returns a new gmage scaled by the provided factor, both width and height. Bilinear interpolation is used for scaling
        Parameters:
        factor - the factor
        Returns:
        a scaled gmage

      • swap

        public void swap(int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2)
        Swaps pixels at coordinates (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
        Parameters:
        x1 - the x coordinate of the first pixel to swap
        y1 - the y coordinate of the first pixel to swap
        x2 - the x coordinate of the second pixel to swap
        y2 - the y coordinate of the second pixel to swap
